1.name: ltpgtltspanStylecolor
1.text:
READ ALL OF THIS INFORMATION BEFORE
YOU BEGIN COMPLETING THIS FORM

IF YOU NEED HELP

If you need help with this form, complete as much of it as you can and call the phone number provided on the letter sent with the form, or contact the person who asked you to complete the form. If you need the address or phone number for the office that provided the form, you can get it by calling Social Security at 1-800-772-1213 (TTY 1-800-325-0778).

HOW TO COMPLETE THIS FORM

The information that you give on this form will be used to make a decision on the disabled person's claim. You can help by completing as much of the form as you can. When a question refers to the "disabled person," it refers to the person who is applying for or receiving disability benefits.

It is important that you tell us what you know about the disabled person's activities and abilities.

  • Print or type.
  • DO NOT LEAVE ANSWERS BLANK. If you do not know the answer or the answer is "none" or "does not apply," please write "don't know" or "none" or "does not apply."
  • Do not ask a doctor or hospital to complete this form.
  • Be sure to explain an answer if the question asks for an explanation, or if you think you need to explain an answer.
  • If more space is needed to answer any questions, use the "REMARKS" section on Page 10, and show the number of the question being answered.
  • If a specific activity is performed with the help of others, please indicate that.

193.name: input193
193.text: 3. YOUR DAYTIME TELEPHONE NUMBER (If there is no telephone number where you can be reached, please give us a daytime number where we can leave a message for you.)

317.name: name317
317.text: Name of person completing this form:

Number and Street: St. 41
City: Austin

351.name: ltpStyletextalign351
351.text:
Privacy Act Statements
Collection and Use of Personal Information  

Sections 205(a), 223(d), 1631(d)(1), and 1631(e)(1) of the Social Security Act, as amended, allow us to collect this information. Furnishing us this information is voluntary. However, failing to provide all or part of the information may prevent an accurate and timely decision on any disability claim filed.

We will use the information you provide to make a determination of eligibility for benefits. We may also share your information for the following purposes, called routine uses:

• To contractors and other Federal agencies, as necessary, for the purpose of assisting the Social Security Administration (SSA) in the efficient administration of its programs. We will disclose information under this routine use only in situations in which we may enter into a contractual or similar agreement to obtain assistance in accomplishing an SSA function relating to this system of records; and

• To applicants, claimants, prospective applicants or claimants, other than the data subject, their authorized representatives or representative payees to the extent necessary to pursue Social Security claims and to representative payees when the information pertains to individuals for whom they serve as representative payees, for the purpose of assisting SSA in administering its representative payment responsibilities under the Social Security Act and assisting the representative payees in performing their duties as payees, including receiving and accounting for benefits for individuals for whom they serve as payees.

In addition, we may share this information in accordance with the Privacy Act and other Federal laws. For example, where authorized, we may use and disclose this information in computer matching programs, in which our records are compared with other records to establish or verify a person’s eligibility for Federal benefit programs and for repayment of incorrect or delinquent debts under these programs.

A list of additional routine uses is available in our Privacy Act System of Records Notices (SORN) 60-0089, entitled Claims Folders System, as published in the Federal Register (FR) on October 31, 2019, at 84 FR 58422, and 60-0320, entitled Electronic Disability Claim File, as published in the FR on June 4, 2020, at 85 FR 34477. Additional information, and a full listing of all of our SORNs, is available on our website at www.ssa.gov/privacy.

Paperwork Reduction Act Statement - This information collection meets the requirements of 44 U.S.C. § 3507, as amended by section 2 of the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995. You do not need to answer these questions unless we display a valid Office of Management and Budget (OMB) control number. We estimate that it will take about 61 minutes to read the instructions, gather the facts, and answer the questions. Send only comments regarding this burden estimate or any other aspect of this collection, including suggestions for reducing this burden to: SSA, 6401 Security Blvd, Baltimore, MD 21235-6401.

353.name: input353
353.text:
Anyone who makes or causes to be made a false statement or representation of material fact for use in determining a payment under the Social Security Act, or knowingly conceals or fails to disclose an event with an intent to affect an initial or continued right to payment, commits a crime punishable under Federal law by fine, imprisonment, or both, and may be subject to administrative sanctions.

SECTION A - GENERAL INFORMATION

355.name: 4aWheredoyouliveCheckone
355.text: 7. a. Where does the disabled person live? (Check one.)

356.name: bWith
356.text: b. With whom does he/she live? (Check one.)

357.name: input357
357.text: SECTION B - INFORMATION ABOUT ILLNESSES, INJURIES, OR CONDITIONS

358.name: 8How
358.text: 8. How does this person's illnesses, injuries, or conditions limit his/her ability to work?

359.name: ltpStyletextalign359
359.text: SECTION C - INFORMATION ABOUT DAILY ACTIVITIES

360.name: 9Describe
360.text: 9. Describe what the disabled person does from the time he/she wakes up until going to bed.

361.name: 10Does
361.text: 10. Does this person take care of anyone else such as a wife/husband, children, grandchildren, parents, friend, other?

362.name: 11Does
362.text: 11. Does he/she take care of pets or other animals?

363.name: ifyes
363.text: If "YES," for whom does he/she care, and what does he/she do for them?

364.name: 12Does
364.text: 12. Does anyone help this person care for other people or animals?

365.name: ifyes365
365.text: If "YES," what does he/she do for them?

366.name: 14Do
366.text: 14. Do the illnesses, injuries, or conditions affect his/her sleep?

367.name: ifyes367
367.text: If "YES," who helps, and what do they do to help?

368.name: 13What
368.text: 13. What was the disabled person able to do before his/her illnesses, injuries, or conditions that he/she can't do now?

369.name: 15Personal
369.text: 15. PERSONAL CARE: Does the disabled person have PROBLEMS with personal care?

371.name: input371
371.text: a. Explain how the illnesses, injuries, or conditions affect this person's ability to:

372.name: 12Do372
372.text: b. Does he/she need any special reminders to take care of personal needs and grooming?

384.name: cDoes
384.text: c. Does he/she need help or reminders taking medicine?

385.name: ifyes385
385.text: If "YES," what type of help or reminders are needed?

386.name: aDoes
386.text: a. Does the disabled person prepare his/her own meals?

387.name: ifyes387
387.text: If "YES," what kind of help does he/she need?

389.name: cDo389
389.text: c. Does he/she need help or encouragement doing these things?

390.name: ifyes390
390.text: If "Yes," what kind of food is prepared? (For example, sandwiches, frozen dinners, or complete meals with several courses.)

391.name: howOften
391.text: How often does he/she prepare food or meals? (For example, daily, weekly, monthly.)

392.name: anyChanges
392.text: Any changes in cooking habits since the illness, injuries, or conditions began?

393.name: howLong
393.text: How long does it take him/her?

394.name: bIf
394.text: b. If "No," explain why he/she cannot or does not prepare meals.

396.name: a
396.text: a . List household chores, both indoors and outdoors, that the disabled person is able to do . (For example, cleaning, laundry, household repairs, ironing, mowing, etc.)

397.name: bHow
397.text: b. How much time do chores take, and how often does he/she do each of these things?

399.name: dIf
399.text: d. If the disabled person doesn't do house or yard work, explain why not.

403.name: aHow
403.text: a. How often does this person go outside?

405.name: ifHeshe
405.text: If he/she doesn't go out at all, explain why not.

406.name: bWhen
406.text: b. When going out, how does he/she travel? (Check all that apply.)

407.name: cWhen
407.text: c. When going out, can he/she go out alone?

408.name: dDoes
408.text: d. Does the disabled person drive?

409.name: ifno
409.text: If "NO," explain why he/she can't go out alone.

410.name: ifYou410
410.text: If he/she doesn't drive, explain why not.

412.name: aIf
412.text: a. If the disabled person does any shopping, does he/she shop: (Check all that apply.)

413.name: bDescribe
413.text: b. Describe what he/she shops for.

414.name: cHow
414.text: c. How often does he/she shop and how long does it take?

415.name: ltpgtltstronggtltspanStylefontsize415
415.text:
20. MONEY

a. Is he/she able to:

420.name: useA420
420.text: b. Has the disabled person's ability to handle money changed since the illnesses, injuries, or conditions began?

422.name: ifyes422
422.text: If "YES," explain how the ability to handle money has changed

425.name: aWhat
425.text: a. What are his/her hobbies and interests? (For example, reading, watching TV, sewing, playing sports, etc.)

426.name: bHow426
426.text: b. How often and how well does he/she do these things?

427.name: cDescribe
427.text: c. Describe any changes in these activities since the illnesses, injuries, or conditions began.

429.name: aHow429
429.text: a. How does the disabled person spend time with others? (Check all that apply.)

430.name: bDescribe430
430.text: b. Describe the kinds of things he/she does with others.

431.name: howOften431
431.text: How often does he/she do these things?

432.name: cList
432.text: c. List the places he/she goes on a regular basis. (For example, church, community center, sports events, social groups, etc.)

433.name: doesHeshe
433.text: Does he/she need to be reminded to go places?

434.name: doYou434
434.text: Does he/she need someone to accompany him/her?

435.name: howOften435
435.text: How often does he/she go and how much does he/she take part?

436.name: dDo436
436.text: d. Does this person have any problems getting along with family, friends, neighbors, or others?

439.name: eDescribe
439.text: e. Describe any changes in social activities since the illnesses, injuries, or conditions began.

442.name: 23A
442.text: 23. a. Check any of the following items the disabled person's illnesses, injuries, or conditions affect:

444.name: pleaseExplain
444.text: Please explain how his/her illnesses, injuries, or conditions affect each of the items you checked. (For example, he/she can only lift [how many pounds], or he/she can only walk [how far])

447.name: cHow447
447.text: c. How far can he/she walk before needing to stop and rest?

448.name: ifYou448
448.text: If he/she has to rest, how long before he/she can resume walking?

449.name: dFor
449.text: d. For how long can the disabled person pay attention?

450.name: eDoes
450.text: e. Does the disabled person finish what he/she starts? ( For example, a conversation, chores, reading, watching a movie.)

451.name: fHow
451.text: f. How well does the disabled person follow written instructions? (For example, a recipe.)

452.name: gHow
452.text: g. How well does the disabled person follow spoken instructions?

453.name: hHow
453.text: h. How well does the disabled person get along with authority figures? (For example, police, bosses, landlords or teachers.)

455.name: iHas
455.text: i. Has he/she ever been fired or laid off from a job because of problems getting along with other people?

456.name: ifyes456
456.text: If "YES," please give name of employer.

457.name: jHow
457.text: j. How well does the disabled person handle stress?

460.name: kHow
460.text: k. How well does he/she handle changes in routine?

461.name: lHave
461.text: l. Have you noticed any unusual behavior or fears in the disabled person?

463.name: 24Does
463.text: 24. Does the disabled person use any of the following? (Check all that apply.)
463.prettyFormat: Glasses/Contact Lenses; Artificial Limb; Artificial Voice Box; Exo-skeleton

464.name: whichOf
464.text: Which of these were prescribed by a doctor? If you do not know or do not recall, please write that.

465.name: whenWas
465.text: When was it prescribed? If you do not know or do not recall, please write that.

466.name: whenDoes
466.text: When does this person need to use these aids?

467.name: 25Does
467.text: 25. Does the disabled person currently take any medicines for his/her illnesses, injuries, or conditions?

470.name: if
470.text: If " YES," do any of the medicines cause side effects?

471.name: input471
471.text: If "YES," please explain. (Do not list all of the medicines that the disabled person takes. List only the medicines that cause side effects for the disabled person.)

482.name: ltpStyletextalign482
482.text:
SECTION E - REMARKS

Use this section for any added information you did not show in earlier parts of this form. When you are done with this section (or if you didn't have anything to add), be sure to complete the fields at the bottom of this page.

485.name: doThe
485.text: Do the disabled person do household and yard work?

486.name: doesThe
486.text: Does the disabled person do shopping?

490.name: input490
490.text: If you do not know the answer or the answer is “none” or “does not apply,” please write “don't know” or “none” or “does not apply.”

491.name: 6A
491.text: 6. a. How long have you known the disabled person?

492.name: bHow492
492.text: b. How much time do you spend with the disabled person and what do you do together?

495.name: ltpStyletextalign
495.text: SECTION D - INFORMATION ABOUT ABILITIES
